description: Conversion of a single-family dwellinghouse into two self-contained residential units; single storey rear extension; rear roof extension; and installation of two rooflights to front roofslope (following demolition of existing outbuilding)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s):

2023/87/WERS/301 (Existing Floor Plans and Block Plan); 2023/87/WERS/302 (Existing Elevations); 2023/87/WERS/305 (Existing Loft Plan and Section); 2023/87/WERS/303/E (Proposed Floor Plans and Block Plan); 2023/87/WERS/304 (Proposed Elevations); 2023/87/WERS/306/B (Proposed Loft Plan and Section); 87/WERS/CYCLE/REV A (Bicycle Storage Details); 87/WERS/BIN (Bin Store Details)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing dwellinghouse on site.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | No part of the flat roofs of the proposed dwellinghouse shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A ,7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021). | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining/stacked dwellings/areas, namely,  bedroom adjoining the communal main entrance and adjoining/ below staircase and  kitchen/ dining/ living room of the first floor flat. The assessment and mitigation measures shall have regard to standards of the Council's SPG10 and noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.
Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies Standard 30 London Housing SPG 2016 and Policy D14 London Plan.

| The bicycle storage area identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved flats and shall be permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: To provide adequate cycle storage facilities for future occupiers in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| The refuse and recycling storage area identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved flats and shall be permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To provide adequate refuse facilities for future occupiers in accordance with policy SI7 of the London Plan (2021) and Ealing Council Waste Management Guidelines for Architects and Developers.
